summary: The London Underground, also called the Tube, is a fast train system in London and nearby areas. It started in 1863 as the world's first underground passenger train. Now, it has 11 lines, 272 stations, and 250 miles of tracks. Most of the system is above ground, not underground. It was owned by different companies but is now run by Transport for London. The Underground is very popular, with 5 million passengers daily. Its famous features include the Tube map, the roundel logo, and the Johnston font.
title: London Underground
